wikipedia_page.main: Charles Frederick D'Arcy (2 January 1859 – 1 February 1938) was a Church of Ireland bishop.  He was the Bishop of Clogher from 1903 to 1907 when he was translated to become Bishop of Ossory, Ferns and Leighlin before then becoming the Bishop of Down, Connor and Dromore. He was then briefly the Archbishop of Dublin and finally, from 1920 until his death, Archbishop of Armagh. He was also a theologian, author and botanist.
